DOC.brief_summary: Investigators propose refine test feasibility acceptability 4-month multi-modal lifestyle intervention African American female breast endometrial cancer survivor diagnose type 2 diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Translating Healthy Lifestyle Interventions Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: Recent systematic review meta-analyses cohort study show physical activity reduce mortality morbidity diabetes obesity-related cancer . Yet , effort promote physical activity within context female cancer survivorship , particularly among woman diabetes . In response , investigator propose refine test feasibility acceptability 4-month multi-modal lifestyle intervention African Americans ( AA ) diabetes breast endometrial cancer survivor . This web-based , lifestyle intervention , couple coach call in-person exercise session , may effective way promote physical activity healthy survivorship . The primary goal participant participate 30 minute moderate-to-vigorous physical activity five time week . The investigator ' aim : ) refine theory-driven healthy lifestyle intervention , deliver via computer technology periodic in-person group exercise session appropriate content , literacy demand graphic , ii ) ass preliminary effect intervention primary outcome level moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) , measure accelerometry ; weight A1C evaluate effect eat behavior , wellbeing/functioning ( quality life , depressive symptom , self-efficacy ) , compliance/adherence protocol acceptability response intervention .
DOC.criteria: African American woman , age 30 No evidence pregnancy , evidence negative urine pregnancy test . Diagnosed type 2 diabetes provider Diagnosed Stage IIII breast endometrial cancer Completed treatment breast endometrial cancer least 4 month 5 year ago Englishspeaking Agree participate aspect semistructured interview ( Aim 1 ) Agree participate aspect feasibility study , include group session ( Aim 2 ) Access internet via phone computer Access work phone personal use NonEnglish speaking Recent epilepsy , cardiac event stroke last 6 month , special nutritional need ( e.g . current evidence malignancy ; HIV ) History epilepsy , cardiac event stroke within last year Known diagnosis HIV Known new malignancy Less 4 month 2 year post treatment Stage IIII breast endometrial cancer .
